pullRequest.body: I extracted a part of the [pull request of Hoeffding's lemma](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18091).

nodes.body:
### PR summary [48949c913e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20017/commits/48949c913ef05982473d93a7fa57f9344f0979d3)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Integrable.of_mem_Icc`
`+ aemeasurable_exp_mul`
`+ integrable_exp_mul_of_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I have a consultation.
As mentioned before, integrable_expt could have a shorter proof, but I couldn't figure out which theorem in mathlib I should apply to prove it directly. Could you tell me which theorem might be useful?

> I have a consultation. As mentioned before, integrable_expt could have a shorter proof, but I couldn't figure out which theorem in mathlib I should apply to prove it directly. Could you tell me which theorem might be useful?

In your other PR #18091 you have a lemma `integrable_bounded`, that you could use here (unless I overlooked something).

> > I have a consultation. As mentioned before, integrable_expt could have a shorter proof, but I couldn't figure out which theorem in mathlib I should apply to prove it directly. Could you tell me which theorem might be useful?
> 
> In your other PR #18091 you have a lemma `integrable_bounded`, that you could use here (unless I overlooked something).

The premise of integrable_bounded `(h : ∀ᵐ ω ∂μ, X ω ∈ Set.Icc a b)` is different from that of integrable_expt `(hb : ∀ᵐ ω ∂μ, X ω ≤ b)`, so I think integrable_bounded cannot be applied directly.
exp(t X) is bounded between 0 and exp(t b) (since t>=0 and X <= b)
I shorten the proof so please check if you have time
Can you please resolve the comments that you have addressed?

> Can you please resolve the comments that you have addressed?

I've resolved the comments.
This docstring refers to results that are not in this PR. Please remove it. Please also remove the two books you add in the references bib file, since you don't refer to them in this PR.

A better name would be `integrable_of_mem_Icc`.
This lemma should be moved to a more appropriate place: it is about integrability in general, and not about moments. You can use `#find_home! integrable_of_mem_Icc` to suggest a more suitable file. Probably Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.L1Space

```suggestion
   exact ⟨hX.aestronglyMeasurable, m1⟩
```

```suggestion
  (measurable_exp.comp_aemeasurable (hX.const_mul t)).aestronglyMeasurable
```

A better name:
```suggestion
lemma aemeasurable_exp_mul {X : Ω → ℝ} (t : ℝ) (hX : AEMeasurable X μ) :
```

4 comments:
- a suggestion for a better name
- this is also true for `t = 0` so you should use `ht : 0 ≤ t`
- we don't use hypotheses of the shape `t > 0`, but use `0 < t` instead. 
- Some parentheses were not necessary
```suggestion
lemma integrable_exp_mul_of_le [IsFiniteMeasure μ] {X : Ω → ℝ} (t b : ℝ) (ht : 0 ≤ t)
    (hX : AEMeasurable X μ) (hb : ∀ᵐ ω ∂μ, X ω ≤ b) :
    Integrable (fun ω ↦ exp (t * X ω)) μ := by
```

```suggestion
    (measurable_exp.comp_aemeasurable (hX.const_mul t)) h
```

```suggestion
    AEStronglyMeasurable (fun ω ↦ rexp (t * X ω)) μ :=
```

```suggestion
theorem Integrable.of_mem_Icc [IsFiniteMeasure μ] (a b : ℝ) {X : α → ℝ} (hX : AEMeasurable X μ)
```

pullRequest.title: feat: integrable_expt
